conclusion: Plan to analyze the p-V diagram to understand processes and determine net heat transfer.
The p-V diagram shows four processes labeled a, b, c, and d with vertical and curved lines.
Identify adiabatic processes as a to b and c to d, where temperature remains constant.
Identify isochoric processes as b to c and d to a, where volume remains constant.
Analyze the cycle starting at O, moving through a, b, c, and back to O.
During adiabatic processes, no heat is transferred; during isochoric processes, heat is absorbed and released.
Net heat transfer is determined by the isochoric processes since adiabatic processes do not involve heat transfer.
Conclude that the amount of heat absorbed is greater than the amount of heat released during the complete cycle.
